isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL RIDE OPTIMIZED SUSPENSION (IROS) - SUSPENSION DUMP FEATURE

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The Suspension Dump Feature controls permit the driver to deflate the air springs from the cab when hooking up to a trailer. This operation and is done by a solenoid ( Figure 8) switch in the 4200, 4300 and 4400 series vehicles located in the center dash panel.

In the 9000 series vehicle cab air operations an "air suspension cab control valve". This control valve will located on the lower dash panel. This control will be in the RUN position. To dump the air from the springs, place the valve in the DUMP position. The switch has a guard to prevent an unintentional air dump. Do not remove the guard. Refer to Figure 12, Item 3.
